column4: scp -vv -C -P 39999 crow@192.294.12.149:hardware.html  I am trying to copy a file from the remote system to my computer, this command is not working, what's wrong, the remote ip is 192.294.12.149. I can SSh, just the syntax is wrong. please help
Use ...149:~/path/to/hardware.html
Maybe... 149:~/Desktop/hardware.html
ok i want to copy the hardware.html file from the home dir. thats why I did not specify ~
Use ~/hardware.html then.
tried ~ does not work. It used to work,
Paste the whole line.
scp -vv -C -P 39999 crow@192.294.12.149:~hardware.html
scp -vv -C -P 39999 ~/hardware.html crow@192.294.12.149
no I want to copy from remote system, not to
scp -vv -C -P 39999 crow@192.294.12.149:~/hardware.html
Great.
sorry about the confusion, I got the hardware file, i could not get the .x11vncrc file, it would not copy to my ~ had to copy it to desktop
Are you on local network?
192* I think so. Use Places --> Connect To Server.
some on local, some on the net.
I had to replace the .x11vncrc file on my system. it just would not copy to the ~ but copy to Desktop
Okay. Use Places --> Connect To Server --> SSH.
Perhaps the file exist.
no the file does not exist. i am sure. it might me  the way scp works. its a . file
Well if it went to Desktop, I'm sure you can just mv it.
thanks, back to work
